titleStmt.title: William Waters to Sir Thomas Hardy — Birthday Postcard

publicationStmt.p: Unpublished autograph postcard held at the Dorset History Centre / Dorset Museum, MS H.1369.

support.p: One commercially printed, embossed colour postcard, “Best Wishes on Your Birthday,” depicting a rural scene with sheep beside a brook. Reverse inscribed in black ink.

layout.p: Message occupies left-hand half of verso; recipient’s name written at right. Printed text and floral embossing visible in border.

handNote.p: Careful upright round hand with moderate spacing, written in black ink; some words in smaller hand for emphasis.

msDesc.note: Commercial birthday postcard with embossed floral border and printed colour illustration on recto.
Archival pencil note “H.1369” upper right verso; address in printed blue ink “POST CARD.”

abstract.p: Birthday greeting from William Waters of London to Sir Thomas Hardy, expressing admiration and good wishes for Hardy’s continued happiness and success.

note.p: This postcard was sent to Thomas Hardy at Max Gate, Dorchester, probably in connection with his birthday, celebrated annually on 2 June. It demonstrates Hardy’s enduring public popularity among ordinary readers in interwar Britain.

div.note: Printed on recto: “Best wishes on your birthday. How pleasant is the summer scene, With cooling brook and pasture green.” (No. 375/4)
div.p:
Just a card in remembrance of your birthday.
Wishing you happiness and success for many years to come.
from a young reader of your works
William Waters
